content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.8+): Begin on either the Canyoneering Route or Fissure of Green and climb up the the anchor on the backside of the Superslab Boulder. Belay your party up to the ledge.

 Pitch 2 (5.8): Traverse to the right, leaving the ledge for the exposed upper wall of the amphitheater. Work your way to the large bench formation and clip into the anchor. Bring your party to this ledge. Note, for parties of 3 or more, they will have to tuck themselves under the small roof feature.

 Pitch 3 (5.9): Traverse right for one bolt, Then begin cranking straight up through a dihedral. Utilize good holds while protecting the crack to reach the cracks end just below a large ledge. Climb out right and up to top out the ledge and reach the anchor. Belay you party up from here.

Descent: Do Not Rappel! Walk off climbers left and out of the amphitheater.
content.protection:
Each pitch require no more than 6 quickdraws, belay station are bolted, but bring cordalette to build equalized anchor.  

  NOTE: If a partner falls on the traverse, it may be extremely difficult to get back on route, so make sure to have plenty of rope to lower them to the ground if need be.

climbs.name: Where The Boardwalk Ends
climbs.fa: Dave Hug, Bailey Bunyan, Max Walsh, Molly Gabel, Chris Nevell

content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.8+): Begin on either the Canyoneering Route or Fissure of Green and climb up the the anchor on the backside of the Superslab Boulder. Belay your party up to the ledge.

Pitch 2 (5.8): Traverse to the right, leaving the ledge for the exposed upper wall of the amphitheater. Work your way to the large bench formation and clip into the anchor. Bring your party to this ledge. Note, for parties of 3 or more, they will have to tuck themselves under the small roof feature.

Pitch 3 (5.10d): Traverse right for two bolts, Then begin cranking straight up through a bulge. Perform some classic Giant City bulge moves and gain access to a ledge. Pull one more buldge and reach the anchor. Belay you party up from here.

 Descent: Either rappel down or walk climbers left and out of the amphitheater.
content.protection:
Each pitch require no more than 6 quickdraws (plus anchor), belay stations are bolted including equalized hardware, but bring cordalette to build equalized anchor.

 NOTE: If a partner falls on the traverse, it may be extremely difficult to get back on route, so make sure to have plenty of rope to lower them to the ground if need be.

Pitch 1: 4. Bolts + Anchor

 Pitch 2: 6 Bolts + Anchor

 Pitch 3: 4 Bolts + Anchor

content.description: Beginning on a juggy sidepull, work through a series of pinches, pockets, and underclings to eventually get stood up in the large heuco. From here, work through a series of sloper and edge holds to the final crimpy rail of the lower section. Power through, and enjoy grabbing the victory jug. Fun climbing awaits you from above as you work towards the anchor, but its not over until its over.
content.location: Far left side of the Amphitheatre, accross the cave from the Canyoneering Route.

content.description: Shares the start with "The Silmarillion." Stick clip bolts one and two; bolt one is meant to keep the belayer from getting tangled with the climber during a fall. Begin ~8 ft left of the first bolt on a slopey, right-facing rail. Boulder up sequential moves to the obvious horizontal break at about 15 feet. Break hard right, clip an independent third bolt, and connect big huecos to a large eye feature. Execute a hard crux and keep it together out the small roof to reach anchors just over the bulge.
content.location: The second bolted line from climber's left. Shares the start with "The Silmarillion."

content.description: Begin off a small (~1ft) rock stack to reach the first hold, a left hand pocket. Paw your right hand against the wall, paste a foot, and jump to a good edge. Arc rightwards to a slopey, peanut-shaped hueco. Execute a hard and tricky crux, then cop a rest in the large eye feature. Climb through a second crux (shared with "Second Breakfast") and finish above the small roof.
content.location: The third bolt line from climber's left. Starts off a rock stack just right of "The Silmarillion."

content.description: First established by aiding to the second bolt and beginning on the obvious jug features by Dave Hug (5.12), then climbed by Kevin Sierzega with the addition of a challenging 6-move boulder problem from a rock stack.To start, use a large rock stack (see picture) to reach up to the bottom of the pocket feature (the lowest usable holds) located down and right about 4 ft of the first bolt. Trend leftwards, set up on edges, and make a huge bump to a slopey side pull. Climb another 8 bolts of engaging moves, passing a second crux, to the top of the amphitheater.
content.location: The furthest line climber's right at the amphitheater. Begin off a large rock stack to reach the start holds. The stack may need to be "stacked" back up...

content.description: Make you way up some low angle boulders, and climb on top of a ledge. Pull on good holds that aren't easy to find and make your way to the top. A fun addition to the Amphitheater

climbs.name: County Line Divide
climbs.fa: Max Walsh, Molly Gabel, and Dave Hug

content.description:
Pitch 1: Beginning in Fissure of Green or the Canyoneering Route, climb up and build and anchor at the anchor behind the Super Slab Boulder.

 Pitch 2: Walk right along the ledge and over to a bolted route that goes up an angled slab to the left of a roof formation.

 Descent: A 60 meter rope can get you to the ground from the anchor of pitch 2. It will be easier to get to the ground by a pitch 2 rappel

 Fun Note: This route lies almost directly on the border of Union and Jackson County.

climbs.name: Canyoneering Route
climbs.fa: Bailey Bunyan, Molly Gabel, Dave Hug, Max Walsh April 2nd 2019

content.description: Begin up a featured slabby face utilizing creative moves. When it becomes more difficult, turn off your tunnel vision, and let yourself lean back
content.location: Directly left of A Fissure of Green

climbs.name: Canyoneer Slab Extension
climbs.fa: Dave Hug, Molly Gabel, Bailey Bunyan

content.description: Climb the Canyoneering Route or Fissure Of Green and upon reaching the anchors, continue climbing through two more bolts to an even higher 1/2 inch eyebolt anchor setup. A fun continuance of an already creative route.
content.location: Begin on the Canyoneering Route or Fissure of Green

content.description: Begin on the same right-facing slopey side pull as "The Silmarillion," but climb directly above rather than breaking right. Execute continuously challenging moves up and left to a huge-anchor clipping jug located a few feet below the lip. Climbs like a long boulder problem, thus hard to assign a route grade to…Currently, there is only one-bolt as an anchor...I will install a second plus quicklinks asap...I wanted to provide route info just in case anyone hops on this. Also, I added an anchor just over the bulge on the next tier. Feel free to climb it to this anchor, but that boulder problem is rough!

Climb up the crack system that divides the slabby face. Follow the crack, protecting as needed, until the crack ends. At the end of the crack, work up and left to a bolt, then stem your way out the top. Refer to photo for anchor location.
content.location: Far left side of the Amphitheater.

content.description: The ICA was fortunate to establish sport climbing in the amphitheater climbing area of the Devils Standtable, including steep and challenging free starts found below easier terrain, the latter of which was historically climbed and/or rappelled. Similar to features commonly seen in the Red River Gorge. This is the massive, overhung amphitheater that is left of the Devils Standtable. The  routes that are here are very unique and offer a different feel to Giant City State Park Climbing.
